sentences: Mees, kellest me vaidlesime, on tulnud tagasi.
See on raamat, mille otsin kellestki.
context: The Estonian word 'kellest' is the elative case form of 'kes' (who), used when asking about or indicating the source or origin of something. It functions as the ablative form in the declension system and can be translated as 'whom,' 'about whom,' or 'of whom' depending on context. It answers questions like 'from whom?' or 'about whom?'
